From: do-not-reply@GovKnowledgeNetwork.org [mailto:do-not-reply@GovKnowledgeNetwork.org] 
Sent: Tuesday, August 20, 2013 7:02 AM
To: Pamela Muse
Subject: Karl Hafer posted a question: 'Best Practices or Innovative Approaches to County Comprehensive Planning'
I am working on a project with the goal of providing our county administration a good set of options for how to approach changing our comprehensive plan. It has been about a decade since the current plan was adopted by our Board of Supervisors. The current plan is truly comprehensive--it encompases our entire county in one document and took an incredible amount of time and work to complete. 
Specifically, I would like to provide options like approaching the plan from an area by area approach or other options. 
Half of Loudoun county is very rural, with an agricultural/equestrian economy and the other half is rapidly growing with Dulles International Airport at the easternmost part of the county. 
I would appreciate any articles or books which others may be able to recommend on this topic. I am not a planner, but am looking forward to learning as much as I can about this topic!
Please feel free to contact me if you can provide any in depth assistance. I am considering developing a list with the approaches taken by a few jurisdictions. 
Thank you!
